<title level="1" right="Rules">[Portcullises](/Rules.aspx?ID=623)</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 515 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
A portcullis is a wooden or iron grate that descends to seal off a gate or corridor. Most are raised on ropes or chains operated by a winch, and they have locking mechanisms that keep them from being lifted easily. The rules on lifting a portcullis or bending its bars appear in the sidebar on this page. If a portcullis falls on a creature, use a [slamming door](/Hazards.aspx?ID=3) trap.
</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>
